titleStmt.title: Thirty queries, modestly propounded in order to a discovery of the truth, and mind of God, in that question, or case of conscience; whether the civil magistrate stands bound by way of duty to interpose his power or authority in matters of religion, or worship of God. By John Goodvvin, minister of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
titleStmt.author: Goodwin, John, 1594?-1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.M. for Henry Cripps and Lodowick Lloyd,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
